title: 113_s2005
content: The Act may be cited as the "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013". It involves the reporting of certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is being amended to include new subparagraphs related to hospital payment data reporting. The Social Security Act is being amended to include new subparagraphs related to hospital payment data reporting. Hospitals must report payment data to the Secretary for uninsured and insured patients for specific procedures. The procedures for reporting hospital payment data include the 50 most common diagnosis-related groups and ambulatory payment classification groups. Data must be transparent and publicly available on a searchable website for consumer comparison by zip code. The amendments made by this section require hospitals to report payment data for comparison by zip code on their website for consumer understanding. Effective for contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act. The Act requires Medicare Payment Advisory Commission reports to include information on charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends must be made publicly available. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to require the Secretary of the Treasury to post data on a publicly accessible website for meaningful comparisons by zip code. Additionally, hospitals must provide a link to this data on their home webpage as per the Medicare requirement. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to require hospitals to include a link on their website to data posted under section 9007(e)(2)(C) for contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act.
